content: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <metadata> <idinfo> <citation> <citeinfo> <origin>California Environmental Public Health Tracking Program</origin>  <pubdate>20120919</pubdate>  <title>Age-adjusted cancer incidence rates by county and year, 1999-2009</title>  <onlink>http://www.ehib.org/page.jsp?page_key=131</onlink> </citeinfo> </citation> <descript> <abstract>This dataset contains age-adjusted incidence rates for 26 malignancy/age group/gender combinations for the years 1999-2009. These data are stratified by year and county of residence.</abstract>  <purpose>To provide data for the National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network consistent with the guidance for creating cancer incidence Nationally Consistent Data and Measures (NCDMs).</purpose>  <supplinf>These data were produced by the California Cancer Registry (CCR), which was established in accordance with the California Health and Safety Code sections 103875, 103885, and 100330.  CCR collects information on over 140,000 cancer cases annually, including demographic data, cancer type, extent of disease at diagnosis, treatment, and survival.  Cancers include all malignant neoplasms, regardless of tissue origin, including malignant lymphoma, Hodgkin Disease, and leukemia, but excluding basal cell and squamous cell carcinoma of the skin, cervical carcinoma in situ, and grade III cervical intraepithelial neoplasia.  CCR operates in support and coordination with the National Program of Cancer Registries (NPCP) at the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Surveillance Epidemiology and End Results (SEER) program of the National Cancer Institute.</supplinf>  </descript> <timeperd> <timeinfo> <sngdate> <caldate>200120919</caldate>  <time />  </sngdate> </timeinfo> <current>Publication Date</current>  </timeperd> <status> <progress>Complete</progress>  <update>None planned</update>  </status> <spdom> <bounding> <westbc>-124.5</westbc>  <eastbc>-114.1</eastbc>  <northbc>42.0</northbc>  <southbc>32.5</southbc>  </bounding> </spdom> <keywords> <theme> <themekt>ICD-9-CM</themekt>  <themekey>Cancer, Incidence, SEER, Epidemiology, Health, Disease, Registry, Childhood Cancers, Bladder, Brain/ Central Nervous Systems (<20 years), Breast, Leukemia, Lymphoid Leukemia (<20 years), Acute Myeloid leukemia, Chronic Lymphocitic Leukemia, Lung and Bronchus, Non-Hodgkin\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd\ufffds Lymphoma, Thyroid, Brain/ Other Nervous Systems, Leukemia (<20 years), Acute Lymphocitic Leukemia, Acute Myeloid Leukemia (<20 years), Mesothelioma, Invasive Melanoma, Liver and Intrahepatic Bile Duct Cancers, Kidney and Renal Pelvis Cancers (including Wilms tumor), Larynx Cancers, Pharynx Cancers, Esophageal Cancers, Pancreatic Cancers.</themekey>  </theme> <place> <placekt>FIPS 5-2 (State)</placekt>  <placekey>California, CA, 06</placekey>  </place> </keywords> <accconst> </accconst>  <useconst>This information is provided by the California Environmental Health Tracking Program (CEHTP) in the California Department of Public Health and the California Cancer Registry (CCR) in the California Health and Human Services Agency. Efforts have been made to assure the accuracy of the data. However, no responsibility is assumed by CEHTP or CCR related to materials or how they are represented by those who access this information.</useconst>  <ptcontac> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper>  <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg>  </cntperp> <cntpos />  <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype>  <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor</address>  <city>Richmond</city>  <state>CA</state>  <postal>94804</postal>  <country>United States Of America</country>  </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510)620-3620</cntvoice>  <cnttdd />  <cntfax>(510)620-3720</cntfax>  <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail>  <hours />  <cntinst />  </cntinfo> </ptcontac> <secinfo> <secsys>None</secsys>  <secclass> </secclass>  <sechandl> </sechandl>  </secinfo> <native>R version 2.8.0</native>  </idinfo> <dataqual> <logic>N/A</logic>  <complete>These data are based on a theoretically universal reporting system for California, under which all facilities providing therapy to cancer patients report cases to CCR following guidelines for strict confidentiality protection and data consistency.  It is believed that >95% of cases are reported to CCR within two years of diagnosis.  Veteran's Health Administration (VHA) hospitals in California stopped reporting cancer cases to the California Cancer Registry beginning in 2005, however. Although there is no way to know how many unreported cancer cases were diagnosed in these facilities since that time, historically VHA-reported cases have accounted for approximately 4 percent of all new male cancers reported to the CCR. </complete>  <lineage> <procstep> <procdesc> </procdesc>  <procdate>20120919</procdate>  </procstep> </lineage> </dataqual> <eainfo> <overview> <eaover>Rates are age-adjusted following the 19 age strata employed by the National Center for Health Statistics adjusted to the 2000 U.S. standard million.  Population (denominator) numbers are based on the National Center for Health Statistics bridged population estimates.  Rates based on fewer than 12 cases are not reported.  Disease categories for ADULTS are defined using the following codes from the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, Third Edition, 2000 (ICD-O-3): Liver, C220 (Excl. M-9050-9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Lung and bronchus, C340:C349 (Excl. M-9050-9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Bones and joints, C400:C419 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Soft tissue (including heart), C380, C470:C479, C490:C499 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Female Breast, C500:C509 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Bladder (including in situ), C670:C679 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Kidney and renal pelvis, C649,C659 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Brain and other nervous  system (ONS), C710:C719 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9530:9539, 9590:9989); Thyroid, C739 (Excl. M-9050:9055, 9140, 9590:9989); Non-Hodgkin lymphoma, types 9590:9596, 9670:9671, 9673, 9675, 9678:9680, 9684, 9687, 9689:9691, 9695, 9698:9702, 9705, 9708:9709, 9714:9719, 9727:9729 (9823, 9827), all sites except C420, C421, C424; Acute lymphocytic leukemia, types 9826, 9835:9837; Acute myeloid leukemia, types 9840, 9861, 9866, 9867, 9871:9874, 9895:9897, 9910, 9920; Mesothelioma, types 9050:9055.  PEDIATRIC codes from the ICD-O-3 included: Leukemia, 9800-9804, 9820-9827, 9830, 9840-9842, 9850, 9860-9864, 9866, 9867, 9868, 9870-9894  9900, 9910, 9930-9941/C00.0-C80.9; Lymphoid leukemia 9820, 9822-9827, 9850, 9821/C00.0-C80.9; Acute myeloid leukemia, 9861/C00.0-C80.9; Central Nervous System, 9380 (C72.3), 9381, 9400-9441 (C00.0-C80.9), 9383, 9390-9394/(C00.0/C80.9), 9380 (C70.0-C72.2, C72.4-C72.9), 9380 (C72.3), 9381, 9400-9441 (C00.0-C80.9), 9383, 9390-9394/C00.0/C80.9, 9380 (C70.0-C72.2, C72.4-C72.9); Neuroblastoma and ganglioneuroblastoma, 9490, 9500/C00.0-C80.9; Melanoma, 8720-8790 (C440-C449); Liver and intrahepatic bile duct, behavior 3, C220-C221 (excluding histologies 9590-9989, 9050-9055, and 9140); Kidney and renal pelvis, behavior 3, C649 and C659 (excluding histologies 9590-9989, 9050-9055, and 9140); Tobacco related cancers - all behavior 3 (excluding histologies 9590-9989, 9050-9055, and 9140), Oral cavity and pharynx {Lip (C000-C009), Tongue (C019-C029), Salivary Gland (C079-C089), Floor of Mouth (C040-C049), Gum and Other Mouth (C030-C039, C050-C059, C060-C069), Nasopharynx (C110-C119), Tonsil (C090-C099), Oropharynx (C100-C109, Hypopharynx (C129, C130-C139)}, Larynx (C320-C329), Esophageal(C150-C159), Pancreas (C250-C259). </eaover>  <eadetcit></eadetcit>  </overview> </eainfo> <distinfo> <distrib> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper>  <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg>  </cntperp> <cntpos />  <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype>  <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor</address>  <city>Richmond</city>  <state>CA</state>  <postal>94804</postal>  <country>United States Of America</country>  </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510)620-3620</cntvoice>  <cnttdd />  <cntfax>(510)620-3720</cntfax>  <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail>  <hours />  <cntinst />  </cntinfo> </distrib> <resdesc></resdesc>  <distliab>Data resident on the CEHTP Portal are for public use. Disciplinary action will be incurred for non-compliance or violation of data use agreements.</distliab>  <custom> </custom>  </distinfo> <metainfo> <metd>20120919</metd>  <metc> <cntinfo> <cntperp> <cntper>CEHTP Science Team</cntper>  <cntorg>CDPH/EHIB</cntorg>  </cntperp> <cntpos />  <cntaddr> <addrtype>Mailing and Physical</addrtype>  <address>850 Marina Bay Parkway, Bldg P, 3rd Floor</address>  <city>Richmond</city>  <state>CA</state>  <postal>94804</postal>  <country>United States Of America</country>  </cntaddr> <cntvoice>(510)620-3620</cntvoice>  <cnttdd />  <cntfax>(510)620-3720</cntfax>  <cntemail>data@cehtp.org</cntemail>  <hours />  <cntinst />  </cntinfo> </metc> <metstdn>EPHTN Tracking Network Profile Version 1.2</metstdn>  <metac>None</metac>  <metuc>None</metuc>  </metainfo> </metadata>
